Name: Canopic chest
Description: Along the sides of this chest in the shape of a shrine are black bands containing offering formulae and the name of the owner in hieroglyphs. At the bottom is the niche decoration of the palace faÃ§ade.Front: two winged sun discs hover above a door with double bolt and metal fittings. Underneath, the deceased is offering before Osiris, Isis and Nephthys. The other sides were decorated in the same way with djed-pillars and Isis knots; the lower sections have figurative representations: on the sides is a mummy on a tomb or chest of some sort, guarded by two winged goddesses. On the back is Harakhty in the guise of a falcon with outstrectched wings.Inside, a small bouquet of flowers was found.
